result.execSummary:
The defendant Ricky R Martinez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ricky R Martinez

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ricky R Martinez in court.  Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court for Ricky R Martinez.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

AS TO COUNT ONE; Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    

AS TO COUNT ONE; Defendant ordered to serve 180 DAYS in the House of Correction, credit of 3 days time served, Huber Privileges for work and childcare. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months with the following conditions:

- Sign up for probation no later than October 27th, 2022.
- Serve 60 days condition time, STRAIGHTTIME. STAYED to be used at the agents discretion.
- AODA assessment and compliance with treatment
- Random UA's and breathalyzers. 
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- Maintain absolute sobriety. 
- Mental health assessment and comply with recommendations.
- Obtain/maintain full time work.
- Complete a cognitive intervention class.
- Complete 20 hours of community service.
- Complete a letter of apology to the victim. 
- Submit a DNA sample by October 27th, 2022 and pay the surcharge by 10/25/2023.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept

- Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges by 10/25/2023. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- Defendant advised of his right to appeal.

During the completion of the plea and sentencing hearing. Court accepted the oral amendment of the criminal compliant of the address of the incident. Criminal complaint lists the incident to have occurred at 3219 South 1th Street, in the Cityof Milwaukee, Milwaukee County, Wisconsin.

THE CORRECT ADDRESS IS: 3219 South 13th Street, in the City of Milwaukee, Milwaukee County, Wisconsin.
Received and Filed. Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Received and Filed. Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Ricky R Martinez in court with attorney Matt W Kline.  Defendant Ricky R Martinez in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
